credentials: PHD 2016 Univ of IL at Urbana-Champaign
name: Grace WORK

ratings.comment: Grace Work was a very good professor for Calculus she did a very good job explaining the content and the Calculus concepts were fairly easy to grasp. I only did poorly in this class because I learned I suck at algebra.

I took this class this semester because she was teaching it and had heard good things. She breaks down material in a way that is understandable (almost like a high school class), she has lots of opportunities for students to engage with the material. She answers questions and teaches so that you find the answer on your own, which is impressive.
We loved Dr Work! She always uses examples in her teaching, and I thought she was funny. Great teacher!

Doesn't really help you when you ask questions. Will give you "things to think about", but if you're stuck then they just confuse you more. Basically if you don't understand something it's up to you to figure it out.

Went over multiple example problems in class clearly and slowly, and made it pretty easy to understand. Grade is basically 3 tests but thats universal across all the calculus classes, not just her. Not an easy topic but go to class and do the homework and you'll be fine.
She is very thorough and makes the lectures interesting. The structure was perfect and I would highly recommend her for Math221.
One of the most organized professors I had been with. She teaches material clearly and genuinely wants her students to understand the material.
Professor Work's lectures for 221 were concise and explained a lot of the concepts well. She also uploads the annotated slides later for future reference. Would definitely take again

Math classes at UW-Madison are graded by few things. So it is tough to get good grades is math classes. But Dr. Work does a great job at teaching class content and preparing students for exams. She has great annotated notes in lecture and provides great discussion questions for lecture, examples, and do-it-yourself problems. With great explanations

Dr. Work is a great professor in the math department. She has great slides, gives good examples, and walks students through practice problems. She has great annotated notes that are easy to follow along. She is always open to talk with after class and is very approachable.

Dr. Work is a very good professor.I feel like some of the bad reviews on here are about things she can't really control, as Calc 1 is very standardized across the college. Her lectures are somewhat slow paced, but she really goes in depth about topics. She is definetly the most helpful in office hours, and won't make you feel stupid.
Very good professor.  She does a lot of examples in class which makes the content easier to understand. Make sure to ask questions in discussion and get a lot of practice in before the exams.

Grace Work is a splendid professor. Her lectures are very clear, and she teaches at a moderate pace. Her style of teaching focuses on understanding the topics of calc, allowing students to have a deeper understanding of the theorems and ideas of the class. Homework is assigned through WebAssign, which is irritating, but the grading is exam-heavy.

Calc221 is super fast paced as it is with every professor. It is pretty easy if you have taken Calc before but can be challenging if it is your first exposure. Dr. Work is one of the better Calc 1 professors if you are learning the material for the first time as she will slow down to make sure her class learns the concepts.

She has been the best lecturer I have had so far. This is a calc class so it won't be easy, but having her as a lecturer will definitely help. Her lectures include lots of example problems and discussion questions to keep engaged. She also sends out the annotated notes from each lecture if you missed anything. Overall, I would recommend her!
She was really nice and helpful in office hours but lecture kind of put me to sleep.  She posts everything online after anyways, but most of this class felt like teaching myself calc.
Super nice, takes her job seriously, makes lectures fun, enthusiastic about her work. Best professor available for Calculus 1 for me at the time.
Her course is hard to understand, and the grading system is problematic.
Demonstrates mathematical principles step-by-step.

Loved Dr. Work as a lecturer. Gave great examples for concepts and gave many ways to solve problems. Was always welcoming and helpful in office hours, but very busy. Discussions and lectures are very helpful, but not mandatory. Though, your grade is mostly only based off of the exams which were much harder than the homework and discussions.
Great lecturer, made the concepts extremely clear and answered questions. Taught all exam material well and had helpful reviews in class. Lecture slides were posted.

Discussion quizzes not important, don't stress grades for them they're negligible. Majority grade consists of 2 midterms and final. Lectures not mandatory, not recorded. Practice exams are exactly like actual exams. Average lecturer, never condescending at office hours. % needed for an A ended up being 90 after final. Final harder than midterms.

Loved Dr. Work and found her by far to be one of the best math professors on this campus. The course is exam heavy but every calc 1 professor gives the same exams and has their scores distributed the same way 3. Still, exams are very fair and accurately reflect lectures and practice exam. would take again with Dr. Work in a heart beat.
She gets the job done. She is straightforward and explains things very clearly.
horrible.  dont expect her to round your grade 0.05% to save your grade, even if there are grading issues.  made my life hell

Prof. Work explained everything is a very reasonable and clear fashion.  I usually leave her lecture leaving to questions behind. It is not her fault that the math department made tests super hard (basically you get one question wrong that's 7 points off) and homework difficult. If you can score average above 90 on tests, you should be fine.
Dr Grace work was amazing in class and I felt that I was able to grasp all the class materials by attending the lectures. Would take her class again

Lectures aren't mandatory but are good enough to attend and have interesting discussion questions that help you understand the material. Discussion quizzes have a clear outline for content as well as exams.

Professor Work was an overall really good professor. Clear lecturer, and easy to understand. She will make sure to do lots of example problems in class which helps understand the types of problems you could see on an exam. Calc 1 is very exam heavy and nothing is curved, but Professor Work did an overall good job of preparing me for exams.

She explains the work well and is very thorough and does a lot of examples in class. The only thing I would say is that she does talk and explain quite slow, so if you have trouble paying attention in class or work better in a fast paced environment you might want to try and consider a different professor. But I liked her class, I would recommend.

Worst professor and the toughest grader I have ever met in math classes. The median of each exam is only 50, but the final curve is 90A 85AB 80B. Can't imagine who can get an A in this class. After my calculation, you can only receive C if you are median in every exam.

Dr. Work was a great professor. She was understanding and was happy to help out students when they needed it. For taking Calc for the first time, she made my learning experience the best that it could've been.

Dr. Work gives great lectures and explains things very well. A lot of people are rating the class which is very difficult but as a professor, Dr. Work is excellent. Even as someone who struggled I appreciated her willingness to help outside of class.

Prof Work is a great prof...the class itself is just tough (especially the final). She is very supportive and has office hours three times a week that were useful. Her lectures are clear and informative. I highly recommend taking one of her classes if you like one on one time because she is readily available and super helpful. Great professor!

I liked Professor Work overall and the lectures were pretty straightforward, however, I was pretty much new to calculus and found myself having to teach myself a lot of things outside of class. The examples in class were very baseline and not reflective of the quizzes we would get in discussion or the midterms. 2 midterms and a final.
If you want to get a good grade in this class DO NOT TAKE HER coming from someone who is good at math

Good instructor with a strong understanding of the content. Prof. Work did an excellent job of giving students a chance to work on problems themselves and explained example problems thoroughly. The lectures did not cover all content on the exams, so prepare to teach yourself using YouTube and Khan Academy.

She isn't a bad teacher by any means I just taught myself most of the content because the way she teaches makes it really hard to actually retain the info you need which is annoying. The curve in the class is actually pitted against you- an AB is 90-92 percent and since your grade is based on 2 midterms and a final its hard to get an A

The lectures are very boring, but one can expect that with calculus. She doesn't really make an effort with students, but the class is very large. The TAs do most of the teaching. Definitely take notes and/or look at the lecture slides posted after class. Discussion quizzes every week, 2 midterms, and a final.

Great lectures on the basic concepts, however the homework goes sometimes far beyond in difficulty what she teaches in class. The quizzes are much harder than tests. If you've taken calc before, it will be very easy, otherwise go to lecture and pay attention. She's really nice and easy to understand, but any application problems will be a struggle.
Good professor, lectures match homework and discussion. Lectures have useful discussion times.  Tough tests.

Prof. Work was an ok Professor. The class was heavily determined how you did in the midterms. She over-explained a lot of things in lecture. I had to drop after the second midterm because I got 50-60% on both midterms and there wasnt anything I could do in discussion to bring my grade up. She doesnt not really help in office hours either.

God, this was terrible. No help in the class, no help online at all. She is a very tough grader and overall the second midterm did not match anything that we learned about. She was a huge disappointment and it overall ruined my experience and made me not like math anymore.

Grace's lectures were solid, she went directly to what mattered while providing useful examples that helped you understand the subject. My only complaint is that her weekly quizzes are way harder than the actual tests, which can be a little demotivating, but at the end of the day, they were worth almost nothing so it did not matter.

Dr. Work taught topics in an extremely overcomplicated manner. Only basic examples were given in class, which did not at all match the discussion quizzes or homework, which was frustrating. There was also a huge disconnect with the TA's; more than once my TA told us to put a question mark because he didn't know how to answer a worksheet question.

lectures are boring and not concise and most of the work shown is not useful. Her only redeeming quality is that she is nice. The discussion worksheets and tests are also extremely hard. I have already taken Calc in high school and gotten and A so naturally I though I would do well but Professor Work failed to give me the tools to succeed.

The lectures are easy to understand, but thats only because they cover basic concepts and a few simple problems. The midterms and worksheets are way harder, and its difficult to receive actual help from the professors and TAs. They pile homework on you as well. The fact that I paid for such unhelpful lectures and discussions makes me depressed

The program itself is very difficult and a mess but professor work is a very nice person always willing to explain more deeply. My only issue with her was that there were no difficult models in lecture or in the textbook but the homework and exam questions was taken beyond what we had learned. Claims class is curved but it really is only about 1%

Dr. Work has done amazing this semester. Her lecture is easy to follow, and the in-class activities are great recaps. TA matters more if you have questions about worksheet. The amount of assignments is overwhelming, but the quizzes and midterms are affordable. As an international student with no previous AP cr, it is def an easy A IMO.

I think many of the ratings here are based upon Calc 221 as a program and class, not specifically professor Work. I took AB Calculus my Junior year and got a three, so I knew that this wasn't going to be easy. Professor Work is very clear in her lectures and gives good explanations to questions asked. She is very acessible outside class.

I took calculus in HS and this class was absolutely awful. Madison does not have the best math program either, so it could've been that. Prof Work was not easy to approach and didn't seem to want to help. Her lectures were boring and her explanations were hit or miss. If you don't have to take calc, DON'T

The tests for math221 Fall 2021 were actually horrendous and I have taken AP calc throughout high school. I definitely thought this class would be a review for me since I have learned it all before, but the quizzes and tests are impossible and unfair. Professor Work should have stuck to her other university.

Math has never come easy to me, and part of that was because I just never had any good teachers. This semester, I've had a very different experience. Professor Work explains things very thoroughly, and she works through many, many example problems for lots of practice. She's great! She encourages office hours and gives great last-minute exam advice
Professor Work was extremely easy to follow in lectures, and was very clear with expectations for the class. Do the homework, study, and you'll be fine.
